io.reinert.requestor.core.auth

Class DigestAuth

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.reinert.requestor.core.auth.DigestAuth
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Auth

    public class DigestAuth
extends Object
implements Auth
    HTTP Digest Authentication implementation.
    This class supports digest authentication based on RFC 2617.

    You can register DigestAuth.HashFunctions by calling setHashFunction(String, HashFunction).
    Author:
    Danilo Reinert

    • Field Detail

      • EXPECTED_CODES

        public static int[] EXPECTED_CODES
        An array containing the codes which are considered expected for the first attempt to retrieve the nonce. The default expected code is unauthorized response 401. 404 is put here because some might prevent the browser from prompting the user for the credentials, which will commonly happen if the server returns a 401 response.

      • DEFAULT_MAX_CHALLENGE_CALLS

        public static int DEFAULT_MAX_CHALLENGE_CALLS
        The default number of max attempts for authenticating using one DigestAuth instance. It's normally two because the first attempt fails and returns the info for performing the authentication next.

      • auth

        public void auth(PreparedRequest request)
        Description copied from interface: Auth

        Performs the logic for making the request authenticated, then dispatch the request.

        IMPORTANT: You must call request#send() after the auth has finished in order to dispatch the request, otherwise the request will never be sent.

        The request can be sent only once.

        Specified by:
        auth in interface Auth
        Parameters:
        request - The request about to be sent

      • setMaxChallengeCalls

        public void setMaxChallengeCalls(int maxChallengeCalls)
        Set the max number of attempts to auth. The default is the value of the constant #DEFAULT_MAX_CHALLENGE_CALLS (which is 2 at first).
        Parameters:
        maxChallengeCalls - max number of attempt calls
